excerpt: Multidisciplinary university with 12th to 18th-century buildings & botanical gardens, plus tours.
detail_description: The University of Coimbra is a multidisciplinary institution housed in buildings dating from the 12th to 18th century, surrounded by beautiful botanical gardens. The university offers tours and hosts cultural events such as Mimesis, which aims to promote artistic creation and practice, specialized research, and training in theater, dance, and performance.
name: University of Coimbra

excerpt: Theme park with miniature global village & costume museum, plus exhibition of Barbie dolls.
detail_description: Portugal dos Pequenitos is a theme park in Coimbra, Portugal that offers a unique experience for families and visitors of all ages. The park features a miniature global village and a costume museum, as well as an exhibition of Barbie dolls. Visitors can explore the miniature replicas of famous landmarks from around the world and learn about different cultures in an interactive and educational way. Additionally, the park includes hands-on activities related to science and technology, covering topics such as renewable energy and space exploration.
name: Portugal dos Pequenitos
address: Largo Rossio de Santa Clara, 3040-256 Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Archaeological site with the imposing Gothic ruins of a 1300s monastery & a visitor center.
detail_description: Mosteiro de Santa Clara-a-Velha is an impressive archaeological site featuring the Gothic ruins of a 1300s monastery, along with a visitor center. The monastery, located near the Mondego River, was abandoned and neglected for over 300 years, resulting in remarkably well-preserved yet partially submerged ruins. Visitors can explore the hulking remains, including crumbling cloisters and a dilapidated bell tower that now hosts music concerts and events.
name: Mosteiro de Santa Clara-a-Velha

excerpt: Museum built on Roman tunnels, displaying Gothic sculptures, religious art & 11th-century cloister.
detail_description: The National Museum Machado de Castro in Coimbra, Portugal is a fascinating attraction built on Roman tunnels and showcasing an impressive collection of Gothic sculptures, religious art, and an 11th-century cloister. After exploring the museum, visitors can take a leisurely stroll down Rua Larga to see the arches of the aqueduct and the Botanical Garden.
name: National Museum Machado de Castro
address: Largo Dr. José Rodrigues, 3000-236 Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Romanesque cathedral distinguished by its fortress-like appearance & high, crenellated walls.
detail_description: The Old Cathedral of Saint Mary of Coimbra is a remarkable example of Romanesque architecture, built in the 12th century during a time when Portugal was under threat from the Moors. Its fortress-like appearance with high, crenellated walls reflects this historical context. The cathedral's main portal and facade are particularly striking, especially in the warm evening light. Inside, visitors can admire an ornate late-Gothic retable and a beautiful 13th-century cloister.
name: Old Cathedral of Saint Mary of Coimbra
address: Largo da Sé Velha, 3000-383 Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Coimbra, a riverfront city in central Portugal and the country’s former capital, is home to a preserved medieval old town and the historic University of Coimbra. Built on the grounds of a former palace, the university is famed for its baroque library, the Biblioteca Joanina, and its 18th-century bell tower. In the city’s old town lies the 12th-century Romanesque cathedral Sé Velha.
detail_description: Coimbra, a picturesque city in central Portugal, boasts a well-preserved medieval old town and is renowned for being the former capital of the country. The historic University of Coimbra, located within the city, is famous for its baroque library known as Biblioteca Joanina and an impressive 18th-century bell tower. Additionally, visitors can explore the 12th-century Romanesque cathedral Sé Velha in the old town.
name: Coimbra

excerpt: Catholic parish church containing a mausoleum housing the remains of Portugal's first king.
detail_description: Santa Cruz Church, also known as Santa Cruz Monastery, is a historic Catholic parish church in Portugal with significant royal and religious importance. The 12th-century Romanesque structure houses the mausoleum of Portugal's first king, Afonso Henriques, and his successor Sancho. The monastery features intricate Manueline-style architecture on its facade and beautifully tiled cloisters.
name: Santa Cruz Church

excerpt: 17th-century Catholic cathedral with a facade & interior featuring both Mannerist & Baroque styles.
detail_description: The New Cathedral of the Holy Name of Jesus in Coimbra is a 17th-century Catholic cathedral that showcases a blend of Mannerist and Baroque styles in its facade and interior. Originally built as a Jesuit church over a century, it was designed by architect Baltazar Alvares, drawing inspiration from Lisbon's Mosteiro de Sao Vicente de Fora. After the expulsion of the Jesuits, it became vacant until it was designated as the new cathedral in 1772.
name: New Cathedral of the Holy Name of Jesus (Coimbra)
address: Largo Feira dos Estudantes, 3000-214 Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Circa-1300s gothic monastery abandoned due to floods, with tours of the ruins & excavated artifacts.
detail_description: The Monastery of Santa Clara-a-Nova, a gothic monastery dating back to the 1300s, was abandoned due to flooding. The new convent was built in the 17th century to replace the old one. It features tours of the ruins and excavated artifacts. Located in Coimbra, visitors can explore other nearby attractions such as the Cryptoporticus of Aeminium, Capela do Tesoureiro, and the Machado de Castro National Museum.
name: Monastery of Santa Clara-a-Nova

detail_description: Immerse yourself in the romantic ambiance of Quinta das Lágrimas, where the legendary love story of King Pedro and Ines de Castro unfolds. Explore the enchanting gardens, parks, and picturesque Mondego riverbanks for a truly captivating experience.
name: Quinta das Lágrimas

detail_description: The Joanina Library, also known as the Biblioteca Joanina, is a must-see attraction within the University of Coimbra complex. Named after King Joao V, it was constructed between 1717 and 1728 and is a remarkable example of Baroque architecture. The library's central hall boasts intricate ceiling frescoes and impressive rosewood, ebony, and jacaranda tables.
name: Joanina Library

detail_description: When in Coimbra, don't miss out on a visit to Penedo da Saudade. This picturesque historical garden is perched on a hill, providing stunning panoramic vistas of the city and the Mondego river. Much like Quinta das Lagrimas, Penedo da Saudade is also associated with the romantic tale of Pedro and Ines. It's a serene spot that offers both natural beauty and historical significance for visitors to enjoy.
name: Penedo da Saudade

excerpt: Catholic chapel belonging to a university, featuring a vibrant interior & grand pipe organ.
detail_description: The Chapel of São Miguel is a historic Catholic chapel located within a university campus. Despite its unassuming exterior, the interior is a treasure trove of vibrant art and architecture. The walls and ceiling are adorned with colorful 17th-century azulejos, while religious paintings and an impressive Baroque organ add to the rich history of the chapel.
name: Chapel of São Miguel
address: R. Dr. Guilherme Moreira 10, 3000-210 Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Fine-art collection of noted 20th-century medical professor Bissaya Barreto in his former mansion.
detail_description: Casa-Museu Bissaya Barreto is a charming museum that showcases the eclectic collection of works of the renowned Portuguese physician and art enthusiast, Bissaya Barreto. Housed in his former mansion, the museum features a fine-art collection including paintings, sculptures, and decorative pieces from various periods. The collection reflects Barreto's emphasis on Beauty, Order, Perfection, and Aesthetics.
name: Casa-Museu Bissaya Barreto

detail_description: Café Santa Cruz is a renowned establishment in Coimbra, situated next to the City Hall in the Lower Town. Housed in the former hall of the Santa Cruz Monastery, founded in 1530, it boasts impressive Portuguese Renaissance architecture with maritime motifs. The café is located within the old Church of Sao Joao de Santa Cruz, which underwent various transformations before being repurposed as a café in 1923.
name: Café Santa Cruz

excerpt: Elegant 1700s garden with formal flower beds, soaring fountains & greenhouses for tropical plants.
detail_description: Nestled within the historic University of Coimbra, the Jardim Botânico da Universidade de Coimbra is a stunning botanical garden that dates back to 1537. This elegant oasis features meticulously arranged formal flower beds, impressive fountains, and greenhouses filled with tropical plants. Nature lovers will find this enchanting space a must-visit destination in Coimbra, as it offers an array of diverse plant species from around the globe—all without any admission fee!
name: Jardim Botânico da Universidade de Coimbra
address: CC Martim de Freitas, 3000-456 Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Sprawling Sé Nova fans out from Coimbra University and the elegant, 1600s New Cathedral. The University Science Museum features interactive exhibits, and Casa-Museu Bissaya Barreto displays a former professor’s art collection. There are city views from Penedo da Saudade gardens, and azulejo tiles on an ornate fountain in Sereia Garden. Dining options span classic tabernas to fado music clubs and upscale restaurants.
detail_description: Coimbra (Sé Nova) is a charming area that extends from the prestigious Coimbra University and the grand New Cathedral, dating back to the 1600s. Visitors can explore interactive displays at the University Science Museum and admire an art collection at Casa-Museu Bissaya Barreto. The Penedo da Saudade gardens offer stunning city vistas, while Sereia Garden showcases ornate azulejo tiles on its fountain.
name: Coimbra (Sé Nova)

detail_description: Fado ao Centro is a cultural initiative and performance venue located in a historic city, offering traditional Portuguese music known as fado. This genre features emotive vocals and acoustic instruments like the Portuguese guitar. The venue plays a vital role in preserving and celebrating the rich tradition of fado, which serves as a storytelling medium conveying deep emotional longing.
name: Fado ao Centro

excerpt: Modern pedestrian bridge with colorful railings, offering views of the Mondego River & Coimbra.
detail_description: Ponte Pedonal Pedro e Inês, also known as the Pedro and Ines Bridge, is a modern architectural marvel that spans 180 meters across the Mondego River in Coimbra. This innovative footbridge offers stunning views of the river and leads to the picturesque Mondego Green Park. The bridge's colorful railings and unique design make it a popular attraction for both locals and tourists.
name: Ponte Pedonal Pedro e Inês
address: Pte. Pedro e Inês, Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: Historic 12 hectare garden including a medieval fountain & a stately, luxury hotel.
detail_description: Jardins da Quinta das Lágrimas is a historic 12-hectare garden in Coimbra, offering a serene escape with its lush green spaces, leafy trees, and captivating water ponds. It's an ideal spot for families to enjoy outdoor activities and leisurely walks. The garden holds historical significance as the setting of the tragic love story between Dom Pedro and Ines de Castro in the 14th century.
name: Jardins da Quinta das Lágrimas
address: R. José Vilarinho Raposo 1, 3040-382 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: Parque da Cidade Manuel Braga, also known as Manuel Braga Park, is a delightful urban park nestled in Coimbra, Portugal. This charming green space is named after the esteemed Portuguese poet and writer, Manuel Braga. It provides a serene escape and a verdant sanctuary within the bustling cityscape. The park boasts meticulously manicured lawns and vibrant flowerbeds.
name: Parque da Cidade Manuel Braga

excerpt: Historic poplar forest turned recreation area, with extensive trails for walking, running & cycling.
detail_description: Choupal National Forest, located just outside the city center of Coimbra, is a historic poplar forest transformed into a popular recreational area. Spanning 80 hectares along the Mondego River, it offers extensive trails for walking, running, and cycling. The lush vegetation provides an ideal setting for activities such as jogging and birdwatching. Despite being a protected area with dense foliage, it also serves as a leisure park for locals seeking an escape from urban life.
name: Choupal National Forest

detail_description: The Aqueduto de São Sebastião, also known as Arcos do Jardim, is a 16th-century historical monument in Coimbra. It stands at about 30 meters tall and spans nearly a kilometer with intricate arches and remarkable stonework. Each arch features unique carvings such as rosettes, shells, crosses, or royal coats-of-arms.
name: Aqueduto de São Sebastião / Arcos do Jardim

detail_description: Restaurant Jardim da Manga is a beloved establishment in Coimbra, offering delicious home-cooked Portuguese cuisine. The restaurant has been a staple in the city for generations and is known for its amazing codfish and classic panados. It's not a fancy Michelin-starred place, but rather a simple, community-oriented eatery with friendly staff. Situated near the Monastery of Santa Cruz, it overlooks the Jardim de Manga, adding to its relaxed and lively atmosphere.
name: Restaurant Jardim da Manga
address: R. Olímpio Nicolau Rui Fernandes, 3000-303 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: Zé Manel dos Ossos is a charming and authentic restaurant located in Coimbra, Portugal. It is renowned for its unique decor, with walls adorned with poems written by satisfied customers and a collection of bones and skulls. The menu features traditional Portuguese dishes such as goat and wild boar specialties, including the famous feijoada, best enjoyed with a fruity and full-bodied local wine. The restaurant's popularity often results in long queues due to its renowned spine bones dish.
name: Zé Manel dos Ossos

detail_description: The Arco de Almedina is a historic relic in Coimbra, Portugal, originally part of the town's Moorish walls dating back to the 9th century. It underwent significant restoration in the 12th century and now serves as an entrance to ancient Coimbra. The arch is adorned with a carved image of the Virgin and child as well as a shield. Visitors are encouraged to explore the narrow streets of the old town surrounding this fascinating structure for an enriching experience.
name: Arco de Almedina
address: R. do Arco Almedina 45, 3000-116 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: At the heart of Coimbra lies the iconic Paço das Escolas, also known as University Patio. This historic plaza offers stunning views of the Mondego River and is surrounded by a rich tapestry of history. One of its notable features is the Joanina Library, a World Heritage-listed site dating back to 1290.
name: Paço das Escolas

excerpt: Interactive physics & chemistry exhibits & taxidermied animals in a vintage, scholarly setting.
detail_description: Museu da Ciência da Universidade de Coimbra is a captivating science museum located in Coimbra, Portugal. It offers an array of interactive physics and chemistry exhibits alongside taxidermied animals, all within a vintage and scholarly setting. The museum's eclectic collection is spread across three sections in two buildings, featuring kid-friendly interactive machines, early scientific instruments, fossils, and skeletons.
name: Museu da Ciência da Universidade de Coimbra
address: Largo Marquês de Pombal 3000, 3000-272 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: Mondego's Green Park, located along the picturesque banks of the Mondego River in Coimbra, offers a delightful setting for leisurely strolls and outdoor activities. The park features lush green spaces, charming pedestrian bridges like the Pedro and Ines bridge, and easy access to nearby attractions such as Santa Clara-a-Velha Monastery and Portugal dos Pequenitos pleasure park. This family-friendly destination showcases miniature replicas of Portugal's architectural wonders, providing a unique experience for visitors.
name: Mondego Green Park

detail_description: The Royal Palace, located in Coimbra, Portugal, is a historic site that has played a significant role in the country's academic and royal history. Originally built as a fortress during Islamic rule, it became the first Portuguese royal household in 1131. In the 16th century, King John III expanded the palace to house university spaces and established it as a leading center of learning. The impressive Great Hall of Acts is among the notable rooms inside.
name: Royal Palace

detail_description: The Academic Museum of the University of Coimbra is a unique space dedicated to preserving the intangible heritage of the university and its connection to the city. The museum's collection offers a glimpse into the student community's experiences through evocative rooms, providing insight into academic life in Coimbra and its place in European identity.
name: Academic Museum of the University of Coimbra

detail_description: The Geophysical and Astronomical Observatory of the University of Coimbra offers fascinating extra activities, including stargazing through high-quality telescopes. The observatory's staff is known for being welcoming and accommodating, making it a great place for those interested in learning about and observing celestial phenomena.
name: Geophysical and Astronomical Observatory of the University of Coimbra

detail_description: Nestled within the prestigious Machado de Castro National Museum, Restaurante Loggia offers a delightful dining experience that combines exquisite cuisine with breathtaking views of Coimbra's upper town and the historic University of Coimbra, a UNESCO World Heritage site. This charming eatery allows guests to savor delicious local specialties at reasonable prices while basking in the warm sunlight illuminating the picturesque historical quarter.
name: Restaurante Loggia
address: Largo Dr. José Rodrigues, 3000-236 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: Restaurante Refeitro da Baixa is a unique dining spot in Coimbra, housed in an ancient ceramics factory dating back to 1824. The restaurant is intertwined with a boutique pottery factory that supplies it with beautiful dishware, creating a distinctive atmosphere. Specializing in Mediterranean flavors, this place offers a challenging gastronomic experience. Additionally, visitors can purchase pottery displays and even participate in pottery workshops.
name: Restaurante Refeitro da Baixa
address: Quintal do Prior, Terreiro Erva Nºs 2 a 4, 3000-339 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: Núcleo da Guitarra e do Fado de Coimbra, also known as Torre de Anto, is named after the poet Antonio Nobre who resided here in the late 19th century. This historic site was once a part of the ancient city walls and holds significance as a place where the renowned poet lived during that era.
name: Núcleo da Guitarra e do Fado de Coimbra

detail_description: Praça do Comércio is a charming square located between Ferreira Borges and the river in Coimbra. The area around it is filled with narrow alleys housing unique stores offering a variety of items, from local soccer club jerseys to agricultural tools. The square itself is an elongated plaza surrounded by tall townhouses, with the historic Igreja de Sao Tiago situated at its northern end.
name: Praça do Comércio

detail_description: "Homage to Fado of Coimbra" is a beautiful sculpture by Celestino Alves Andre, paying tribute to the Coimbra Fado. The sculpture depicts a woman with the body of a Portuguese guitar and was unveiled in 2013 near the Arco de Almedina. This artwork captures the essence of Coimbra's musical tradition.
name: Homage to Fado of Coimbra
address: R. do Arco Almedina 21, 3000-116 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: Located on the outskirts of the old town, Jardim da Manga, also known as Sleeve Garden or Sleeve Cloister, is an extension of the Monastery of Santa Cruz. This unique garden in Coimbra features a distinctive fountain that makes it a must-visit for those looking to discover something special in this interesting city.
name: Jardim da Manga

detail_description: Faculdade de Letras da Universidade de Coimbra is a prestigious university known for its ancient history and academic excellence. The faculty offers courses in modern languages, providing students with the opportunity to deepen their knowledge of foreign languages, including Portuguese. The organization of lessons and exams, as well as the teaching methods of the professors, are highly regarded. The campus boasts a monumental building with impressive architecture and decoration that adds to its allure.
name: Faculdade de Letras da Universidade de Coimbra
address: Instituto da Faculdade de Letras da Universidade de Coimbra, Largo Porta Férrea, 3000-370 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: If you're exploring the Santa Clara area, don't miss the breathtaking Hell Valley Viewpoint (Miradouro do Vale do Inferno). This stunning vantage point provides a panoramic view of Coimbra and the winding Mondego River. From here, you can admire iconic landmarks like the Bridge of Queen Santa Isabel while soaking in over 180 degrees of picturesque scenery that includes both urban landscapes and distant mountains. The viewpoint is easily accessible by car, making it convenient for visitors looking to capture beautiful photographs from various angles.
name: Hell Valley Viewpoint
address: Ladeira Vale do Inferno, Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: The Tower of University of Coimbra is a must-visit attraction when exploring the city. It is part of the "Program 1" combo ticket, offering panoramic views of Coimbra and the surrounding countryside. The tower holds historical significance as it once organized the daily activities of university students with its bell. Climbing its 180 steps provides one of the best views of the Mondego river and offers an amazing perspective over Coimbra and its architectural landmarks.
name: Tower of University of Coimbra

detail_description: Largo da Portagem is a charming square located in the heart of Coimbra, Portugal. It is known for its picturesque setting and vibrant atmosphere. The square is surrounded by historic buildings, lively cafes, and shops, making it a popular gathering spot for locals and tourists alike. Largo da Portagem offers a great opportunity to soak up the local culture, enjoy some people-watching, or simply relax with a cup of coffee while taking in the beautiful surroundings.
name: Largo da Portagem

excerpt: Upscale hotel in an 18th-century castle, offering posh dining, 2 pools & a spa with a sauna & a gym.
detail_description: Hotel Quinta das Lágrimas is a luxurious five-star hotel located in an 18th-century castle, offering upscale dining, two pools, and a spa with a sauna and gym. Situated in the hills above Coimbra, this former nobleman's palace features botanical gardens, state-of-the-art spa facilities with city views, two exceptional restaurants including the Michelin-starred Arcadas da Capela, a wine cellar, outdoor pool, Turkish bath and steam room.
name: Hotel Quinta das Lágrimas
address: Rua António Augusto Gonçalves, 3041-901 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: The Church of Santo António dos Olivais has a rich history dating back to the 13th century when it was originally dedicated to Egyptian saint Santo Antao. Later, it was rededicated to Saint Anthony after the founding of the Order of the Friars Minor. The current building and its spectacular tiles inside, depicting the life of Santo Antonio, date back to the 18th century. Visitors can explore where St.
name: Church of Santo António dos Olivais
address: R. Brg. Correia Cardoso 10, Coimbra, Portugal

excerpt: This medieval stone tower was once part of the city's defenses & is decorated with religious art.
detail_description: Porta e Torre de Almedina is a medieval stone tower that was once part of the city's defenses and now serves as a space for art exhibitions and thematic conferences. It is also the oldest private house in town, offering visitors a chance to marvel at its unique architecture. As part of the Municipal Museum of Coimbra, it holds a history dating back to the times of Islamic occupation.
name: Porta e Torre de Almedina
address: R. do Arco Almedina 7, 3000-180 Coimbra, Portugal

detail_description: The spacious Praca da Republica, adorned with a sprawling and intricate design on its pavement, serves as a bustling meeting point for students, professionals, and tourists alike. Settle down in a portable chair at one of the casual metal tables to enjoy a cup of coffee or try out the local Praxis beer. As you relax, young cyclists whiz by while flower vendors attract attention from passersby. Throughout the night, groups of jovial individuals engage in lively conversations.
name: Praça da República

detail_description: The Academic Prison is a museum in the basement of the Joanina Library that exhibits chains used to restrain students who had misbehaved. It can be very claustrophobic, and is not recommended for anyone with phobias about enclosed spaces.
name: Academic Prison

detail_description: Located just south of the monument to Pope John Paul II and east of the Botanical Garden in Coimbra, Portugal, Aqueduto de São Sebastião / Arcos do Jardim may seem like a nondescript series of arches supporting an old bridge at first glance. However, this ancient water pipe is actually a very impressive and well-preserved aqueduct. The surrounding area is beautiful with lush gardens and the university nearby, making it a pleasant place to visit.
name: Aqueduto de São Sebastião / Arcos do Jardim

detail_description: Located at the end of Sa da Bandeira Avenue, Parque de Santa Cruz, also known as Jardim da Sereia or Garden of the Mermaid, is an enchanting 18th-century garden in Coimbra. The entrance features two towers adorned with arches and a staircase with tile-covered benches leading to a fountain adorned with statues. The park offers a serene atmosphere for picnics, with tables available for visitors.
name: Parque de Santa Cruz

excerpt: Museum featuring interactive, educational science exhibits, public events & a 360-degree cinema.
detail_description: UC Exploratório - Centro de Ciência Viva da Universidade de Coimbra is a pioneering interactive science center in Portugal, established in 1995. It forms part of the National Network of Science Centers Ciencia Viva and is located in the Parque Verde of Mondego, Coimbra. The center aims to promote scientific culture through interactive exhibits, public events, and a 360-degree cinema.
name: UC Exploratório - Centro de Ciência Viva da Universidade de Coimbra
address: Rotunda das Lages, Parque Verde do Mondego, Santa Clara, 3041-901 Coimbra, Portugal
